text:
You ignore ChatGPT.

But that's how I steal viral hooks before you:

☑ Go to chat.com/atlas.
☑ Sign in with your ChatGPT account.
☑ Open YouTube. Search your favorite creator.
☑ Click ‘Ask ChatGPT’ on upper right.
☑ Paste this prompt:

“Identify the top 5 best-performing YouTube videos on {CHANNEL_NAME} from the last 5 months by views.
For each of those 5 videos, capture:
1. The video title and thumbnail title verbatim
2. The opening hook (~10 seconds verbatim from transcript)
3. Abstract a HOOK PATTERN (= formula, not wording)
4. Generate 5 hook templates using that pattern → each with 2 angles + 2 ideas on how to adapt to my niche ({YOUR_NICHE})
End with:
• A “Pattern Takeaways” section → 5 bullet insights (max)

Rules:
– Use only verifiable data (views, titles, transcripts); don’t invent any numbers or wording.
– If something is missing (e.g. no transcript), say so plainly instead of guessing.
– Be concise and action-ready, no fluff.
– Structure output exactly as:
1. Title + views + publish age
2. Hook (verbatim)
3. Hook Pattern (formula)
4. Templates + Angles + Adaptations
5. Pattern Takeaways (5 bullets)

If you can’t figure something out, say it out loud and stop there.
Don’t make stuff up.

Goal: I want the same concise, structured pattern-analysis breakdown you gave me for {REFERENCE_CREATOR}’s channel.”

→ Instantly, you get 5 viral videos with their opening hooks.
→ You get a hook template for each, ready to use.
→ Set Atlas to run it every day for a list of creators.
→ You get a daily email reminder to do it.
→ Build your own idea library from these hooks.
→ Give a long form blog to convert into 5-6 hooks.
→ Go to easygen, put the hook, pointers from your blog in ‘Post Topic’.
→ Generate 3-4 post versions.
→ Post on Linkedin.

Use ChatGPT Atlas to turn viral hooks into your own.

You want more? Go to https://lnkd.in/dny9ucjd
You learn something? Repost ♻️ for your network.
